meanings.definition: The beginning or start of something.
meanings.sent1: At the outsets of the race, all the runners lined up eagerly.
meanings.sent2: The outsets of a new project can be both exciting and challenging.
meanings.sent3: The outsets of a joke are crucial for a good punchline.
meanings.sent4: In gardening, the outsets of spring bring new life to the garden.
meanings.sent5: The outsets of a story set the tone for what is to come.

meanings.definition: The point at which something starts.
meanings.sent1: The outsets of the trail marked the beginning of our hiking adventure.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the outsets of a problem is key to finding a solution.
meanings.sent3: The outsets of a movie often hint at what is to unfold.
meanings.sent4: The outsets of a river journey can be both thrilling and peaceful.
meanings.sent5: At the outsets of a journey, the possibilities are endless.
